      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static boolean StormAuthLib.doActivity(StormLogin login)
      Tell StormDev the login session is active (aka the user is doing things) so that the account isn't logged out automatically for being idle.
      static boolean StormAuthLib.doActivity(java.lang.String email, java.lang.String sessionID)
      Tell StormDev the login session is active (aka the user is doing things) so that the account isn't logged out automatically for being idle.
      static LoginInfoResponse StormAuthLib.getLoginInfo(java.lang.String email, java.lang.String code)
      Used to retrieve the login information after a user has logged in using third party authentication.
      static boolean StormAuthLib.isEmailInUse(java.lang.String email)
      Used to check if a StormDev account exists for the given email.
      static boolean StormAuthLib.isSessionValid(StormLogin login)
      Used to determine if a StormDev login session is valid and that the user hasn't logged out
      static boolean StormAuthLib.isSessionValid(java.lang.String email, java.lang.String sessionID)
      Used to determine if a StormDev login session is valid and that the user hasn't logged out
      static LoginRequestResponse StormAuthLib.login(java.lang.String email, java.lang.String password)
      Used to create a new login session or retrieve an existing one with StormDev using the account email and password.
      static boolean StormAuthLib.logout(StormLogin login)
      Logout a StormDev login session (Invalidate it)

      Logout a StormDev login session (Invalidate it)
      static boolean StormAuthLib.logoutBySessionPassword(java.lang.String email, java.lang.String password)
      Logout a StormDev login session (Invalidate it)
      static ClientAuthResponse StormAuthLib.sendClientAuth(StormLogin login)
      This is used when a client wants to prove it's genuinely logged into a StormDev login session to a server or other client, but doesn't want to send the sessionID (Because that'd give the other client/server control of the session).
      static ClientAuthResponse StormAuthLib.sendClientAuth(java.lang.String email, java.lang.String sessionID)
      This is used when a client wants to prove it's genuinely logged into a StormDev login session to a server or other client, but doesn't want to send the sessionID (Because that'd give the other client/server control of the session).
      static ServerAuthResponse StormAuthLib.sendServerAuth(java.lang.String email, java.lang.String clientAuthKey)
      This is the second part of a client trying to prove it's logged in to a valid StormDev login session to a server or other client.
